src/maven/operators/func_validateOperator.cpp

00001 /*
00002  *  maven Programming Language
00003  *  Created by Elliot Chance <elliot@chancemedia.com>.
00004  */
00005 
00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00008 #include "struct_MavenObject.h"
00009 #include "errors.h"
00010 #include "objects.h"
00011 #include "namespaces.h"
00012 #include "constants.h"
00013 #include "operators.h"
00014 #include "enums.h"
00015 
00016 string validateOperator(MavenCompiler* c, string op, string type1, string type2, string& overloaded_function) {
00017         // bug #34: Add all the operators
00018         
00019         // overload check, find the base class
00020         int nID = -1, oID = -1;
00021         findClass(c, type1, nID, oID);
00022         if(nID >= 0 && oID >= 0) {
00023                 // the operator we are looking for
00024                 string opfunc = translateOperatorFunction("operator" + op);
00025                 
00026                 int i;
00027                 for(i = 0; i < c->namespaces->at(nID).objects->at(oID)->functions->length(); ++i) {
00028                         if(c->namespaces->at(nID).objects->at(oID)->functions->at(i).name == opfunc)
00029                                 break;
00030                 }
00031                 if(i < c->namespaces->at(nID).objects->at(oID)->functions->length()) {
00032                         overloaded_function = opfunc;
00033                         return findMavenObjectPath(c, c->namespaces->at(nID).objects->at(oID)->functions->at(i).returnType);
00034                 }
00035         }
00036         
00037         // void is not allowed on either side
00038         if(type1 == "void" || type2 == "void")
00039                 return MAVEN_INVALID;
00040         
00041         // if the types are the same and using =/== is always allowed
00042         if((op == "=" || op == "==") && type1 == type2)
00043                 return type1;
00044         
00045         // boolean operators
00046         if(op == "==" || op == "<" || op == ">" || op == "<=" || op == ">=")
00047                 return "boolean";
00048         
00049         // bitwise operators
00050         if(op == "&" || op == "&=" || op == "|" || op == "|=")
00051                 return type1;
00052         
00053         // natural operators
00054         if(isDataType(type1) && isDataType(type2)) {
00055                 // when using 2 native types the resulting type is the most powerful
00056                 // of the two types
00057                 if(getDataTypePrecedence(type1) > getDataTypePrecedence(type2))
00058                         return type1;
00059                 return type2;
00060         }
00061         
00062         // any Object can be assigned nil
00063         if(!isDataType(type1) && type2 == "nil") return "nil";
00064         
00065         // child objects
00066         if(type1 == "maven.Object" && !isDataType(type1))
00067                 return type1;
00068         
00069         // enums
00070         int enumID1 = findEnumID(c, findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace), type1);
00071         int enumID2 = findEnumID(c, findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace), type2);
00072         if(enumID1 >= 0 && isDataType(type2))
00073                 return "int";
00074         if(isDataType(type1) && enumID2 >= 0)
00075                 return "int";
00076         if(enumID1 >= 0 && enumID2 >= 0)
00077                 return "int";
00078          
00079         // if we made it to here there was no explanation for what the operator is doing
00080         pushError(c, "Invalid operator '%s' between %s", op, "'" + type1 + "' and '" + type2 + "'");
00081         return MAVEN_INVALID;
00082 }
